configValues.description: This plugin signs PDF with xyzmo Seal
configValues.signatureRemarks: This signature was done with xyzmo Server 3.0

attachmentContainer.reason: This is an additional file to the main document
attachmentContainer.contentInfo: Example: This is a XML file which contains the machine processable information of the PDF document. You can print it out and restore the electronic data via scanner and decoding with the xyzmo Client. Go to dig2p.verify.xyzmo.com for more information

help_en.contentTypes: All content-types (aka mime-types) that are supported by this plugin.
help_en.contentType: The content-type (aka mime-type) that is supported by this plugin.
help_en.reginfoAccount: The reference to the xyzmo user account (reginfo account) used for billing (and eventually used for signing)
help_en.signatureAccount: The reference to the configuration for the SignatureAccount
help_en.clickToVerifyImage: An alternative image for the "click to verify" link. When this is used no lock symbol will be used but this image uses up all the available space. In case the sealLayout "miniSeal" is selected, this image represents the lock symbol which is shown on the document.
help_en.miniSealImage: This image is shown instead of the "lock" symbol when using the sealLayout "MiniSeal". For all other layouts this image is used for teh "lock" symbol right to the clickToVerifyImage.
help_en.configName: This is the name of the configuration file of the signture account. Go to global --> sigaccount -> PKCS#12/Smartcard -> select the certificate you wish to use and right-click the certificate. Select "copy config name" and go back here. The paste the copied config name here.
help_en.inkLimitAmountWarning: if the remaining amount of digital ink of you xyzmo user account drops below this level you will get a warning in the logs.
help_en.stampname: The seal logo name which is used. To customize the seal logo, buy a new one (go to global --> sigaccounts --> Reginfo --> select your account --> click on buy ink --> buy a new seal logo via the shop. You will receive a confirmation email stating the "stampname" you have to enter here.
help_en.seallogo: The base64 coded image which will be used as the sealing logo
help_en.sealLayoutBorder: defines weather the signature field has a rectangular border (white background image with borderline). Possible values: 0: borderless and transparent background; 1: border and white background.
help_en.Sigcolor: The color of the handwritten signature string given in RGB tags.
help_en.TextColor: The color of the text given in RGB tags.
help_en.BorderColor: The color of the border if used given in RGB tags.
help_en.BackgroundColor: The color of the background given in ARGB tags.
help_en.SigThickness: The thickness of the signature graphic in pixel.
help_en.SigFieldResolution: The resolution of the rendered signature field graphics. High values mean better quality but larger files, low values result in lower quality and smaller file sizes.
help_en.signatureFontFamily: Font family used in signature text fields
help_en.UseUTCDateTime: Defines weather the "Time" field should show the time in UTC format or in the local time(zone).
help_en.DateFormat: The format of the time which is displayed in the "Time" field.
help_en.language: The language of the signature field's labels (signatureReason, Location, Remarks, Time). This is taken from language file which resides on the server.
help_en.positionReferenceCorner: The positioning reference point. Possible values: Lower_Right, Lower_Left, Upper_Left, Upper_Right
help_en.positionHorizontalMargin: The horizontal margin to the nearest border of the seal measured from the positionReferenceCorner (e.g. from the right margin to the right border of the seal).
help_en.positionVerticalMargin: The vertical margin to the nearest border of the seal measured from the positionReferenceCorner (e.g. from the right margin to the right border of the seal).
help_en.positionUnits: The unit used for the positioning. Possible values: mm, inch, PdfUnits
help_en.positionPage: The page where the xyzmo Seal is placed in the PDF. Possible values: 0-n (page number), -1 (last page), 99999 (additional page)
help_en.useSignatory: Display the name of the signatory. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.useReason: Display the signature reason. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.useLocation: Display the signature location. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.useRemarks: Display the signature remarks. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.useBarcode: Display the Seal Barcode. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.useAttachments: Display the number of attachments. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.useBranding: Display the xyzmo Seal Branding. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.useClickToVerify: Display the "click to verify" button. 1 = yes, 0 = no
help_en.displayNameKey: A custom field which can be used instead of the subject of the certificate and which is specially displayed on the verify page. This is typically used by SIGNificant Online/Offline Client when a biometric signature is used in combination with a default signing certificate. This is the label of the field; e.g: "Digitally signed by". This label is also specially displayed on the verify page (Result Page)
help_en.displayNameValue: A custom field which can be used instead of the subject of the certificate and which is specially displayed on the verify page. This is the label of the field; e.g: "Max Mustermann". => Attention: the displayName is the top field to be displayed.
help_en.customKey1: A custom field which is displayed in the signature field. This is the label of the field.
help_en.customKey2: A custom field which is displayed in the signature field. This is the label of the field.
help_en.customKey3: A custom field which is displayed in the signature field. This is the label of the field.
help_en.customKeyValue1: A custom field which is displayed in the signature field. This is the value of the field. => Attention: the customKeys are the last (bottom) fields to be displayed.
help_en.customKeyValue2: A custom field which is displayed in the signature field. This is the value of the field. => Attention: the customKeys are the last (bottom) fields to be displayed.
help_en.customKeyValue3: A custom field which is displayed in the signature field. This is the value of the field. => Attention: the customKeys are the last (bottom) fields to be displayed.
help_en.signatureReason: A textfield for telling the reason of the signature (optional)
help_en.signatureLocation: A textfield for telling the location of the signature (optional)
help_en.signatureRemarks: A textfield for giving some remarks to the signature (optional)
help_en.useDig2P: Decide weather you wish to use dig2p. Digital 2 Paper enables you to encode digital data into printable data (barcodes) which are attached to the main document, The dig2p behaviour depends on the settings "dig2PResolution", "useDig2PforMainPDF" and "useDig2PforMainPDFConfig". Possible values: 0 (disable - default), 1 (enable).
help_en.dig2PResolution: The resulution which is used for creating dig2p barcodes. Higher resolutions means less dig2p (barcode) pages but also a reduced resistance against errors (poor printer quality). for the currently available printers and scanners on the market we recommend a resolution of max. 300 dpi. 600 dpi is usable for s/w high quality laser printers and high quality scanners. Possible values: dpi_150 (150 dpi - use for very high resistance), dpi_200 (200 dpi), dpi_300 (300 dpi for normal environments), dpi_600 (600 dpi for closed environment with high quality printers and scanners)"
help_en.useDig2PforMainPDF: Define weather you wish to encode the main document itself into dig2p or only the attachments. Possible values: 0 (disable - advantage: the dig2p barcodes are less because the attachment itself is unsigned and therfore smaller), 1 (enable - advantage: the dig2p barcodes contain 100% the same what you see in the main PDF).
help_en.attachmentMode: Enables the use of attachments. Possible values: 0 (all PDFs are signed individually), 1 (if a "customID" and "customRefID" is present in the webservice call or remote file IO config file, the plugin tries to evaluate which is the "main document" (the one the others are referring to). If these values are not present, the first PDF found is taken as "main document", all other files are uses as attachments and are deleted afterwards. The attachments are invisbly put into the main document and can be extracted simply by verifying a documet.
help_en.attachmentContainer: A signed XML container which contains the data which you defined as attachments.
help_en.reason: A textfield for telling the reason of the attachement (optional)
help_en.remarks: A textfield for telling the remarks to the attachments (optional)
help_en.location: A textfield for telling the location for the attachments (optional)
help_en.contentInfo: A textfield for providing further information about the content of the attachments
help_en.src: the "source" where the original document can be fetched.Contains a source where a customer defined action can be started.
help_en.cmd: the command which is provided to the source (e.g. "get")
help_en.opt: the options provided in addition to the command
help_en.uid: an ID which is provided for the document (this can be customer specific)
help_en.xyzmoType: The type of the data. Such data can be interpreted on the verification side. Possible values: none
help_en.customType: a type defined by the user
help_en.externalTimestampConfiguration: This section defines parameters for using an external (non-xyzmo) timestamp provider.
help_en.useExternalTimestampProvider: Enable or disable the use of the configured external timestamp provider. 1 = enable, 0 = disable (default)
help_en.timestampProvider: Select one of the supported timestamp providers.
help_en.timestampProviderUrl: The URL of the timestamp server. The following values are provided: xyzmo: http://sealserver1.xyzmo.com, xyzmo: http://ts1.xyzmosignificant.com, digistamp: http://tsa1.digistamp.com/tsa, a-cert: https://timestamp.a-cert.at:11080
help_en.timestampAuthenticationCertificate: Select the certificate you need to access the timestamp provider.
help_en.timestampCredentialsUser: The username for authenticating versus the timestamp server.
help_en.timestampCredentialsPassword: The password for authenticating versus the timestamp server.
help_en.fallbackTimespan: This is the timespan is seconds after which the system switches back to first timestamp provider in the list.
help_en.signatureHashAlgorithm: Select the signature hash algorith. Possible values: Sha1, Sha224, Sha256, Sha384, Sha512, MD5, RipeMD160. Default is "Sha256".
help_en.defaultBioEncryptionCert: This is the biometric encryption certificate which is used instead of the xyzmo encryption certificate. This requires the public part of a certificates which can imported via global - signature accounts - software.
help_en.width: The width of the signature field. Possible values: 1-n (provided in the positionUnits); empty: (default) in this case the default width and height are used.
help_en.height: The height of the signature field. Possible values: 1-n (provided in the positionUnits); empty: (default) in this case the default width and height are used.
help_en.TabletConfiguration: This section contains the values which a client application has to provide. Typically these values are taken from the tablet.xml on the client side. This is absolutley required for the sealLayout "SignatureOverlayRealSize". If ommited for other layouts, the signature graphics is not scaled in the correct aspect ratio.
help_en.SignatureDataContainer: This parameter is used alternatively to "penSignatureString" + "TabletConfiguration" to provide signature data with a SIGNificant Device SDK 3.1 and higher. This data format already includes the TabletConfiguration data.
help_en.readPassword: The read password of the PDF if necessary.
help_en.pdfa: this sections defines the PDF/A parameters.
help_en.pdfaCompliantSignature: This signes the document PDF/A conformant but does not convert to PDF/A if the document is not PDF/A conformant.
